author: ghosts_in_the_code
content:
"I do kind of like getting people used to the idea that we're actually trying to minimise their staking rewards"

Agreed 100%. I think we've already hit the desired stake (5M ETH), and should now reduce staking rewards so that only technically skilled and politically motivated users remain. There is a clear "political premium" where people will solo stake (not delegate to pool) even at low yield, but that userbase gets diluted when you have say 50M ETH staked.

author: protolambda
content: <@!329594653097721856> The archive mode is rather inefficient; it stores a full copy of the `BeaconState` every `SlotsPerArchivedPoint` slots. This may be very frequent, to quickly serve arbitrary historical data without processing, including validator balances (which change at least 200 times per day, for all validators). I am not sure what the `--archive` flag configures, but I expect it to to be 32 or 64. The default is 2048, and technically you don't need the snapshots at all for already-finalized chain history, as long as you have the blocks to serve others.
